basics.name: Roxana Nick
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Results-driven data scientist with a Master’s in Applied Modeling and Quantitative Methods and expertise in time series analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling. Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and data visualization. Experienced in turning complex data into strategic insights to support business decision-making. Skilled at delivering scalable, data-driven solutions with a strong track record of research, analytics, and project execution.

work.name: medad-ai
work.description: A great startup around AI, trying to build highly scalable search as service and recommendation as service
work.summary: I was responsible for building distributed and scalable services using cloud architecture patterns and also interacting with AI team to build services,
highlights: Bootstrapped a k8s cluster using Kubespray
Distributed k8s between two datacenters
Designed VPC over two datacenters
Designed and implemented a real-time audio and video processing pipeline using micro-service Architecture
Designed and implemented search and recommendation as a service on the result of the pipeline
Designed a real-time billing service using timescale-db
Designed a user tracker service in Rust language
Used redis and redis-stream as message queues between our services
Designed rqueue (reliable queue) with redis
Set up monitoring service using prometheus-operator and grafana
Setup log management using fluentd, fluentbit, Elasticsearch and kibana
Deployed and managed Traefik as API gateway
Deployed minio as S3 Storage

work.name: Trent University
work.description: A public research‐intensive university offering programs across arts, sciences, and professional disciplines.
work.summary: Responsible for designing statistical experiments and developing time series interpolation models to recover missing data and support statistical reporting.
highlights: Designed statistical experiments and time series models to identify anomalies and reconstruct missing data.
Developed and evaluated multiple interpolation models (KAF, EWMA, HWI) to recover incomplete data under various SNRs.
Supported statistical reporting with reproducible documentation, simulations, and visual summaries.

work.name: Trent University
work.description: A public research‐intensive university offering programs across arts, sciences, and professional disciplines.
work.position: R Shiny App Developer – Awards Analytics Project
work.summary: Responsible for automating eligibility analysis for scholarship applicants using statistical logic in an R Shiny dashboard and delivering tabulated summaries and visualizations to support audit-compliant decision-making.
highlights: Automated eligibility analysis for scholarship applicants using statistical logic and an R Shiny dashboard.
Created tabulated summary outputs and graphical visualizations in alignment with reporting best practices.
Reduced manual review time by 60% and supported transparent decision-making through audit-compliant documentation.
Collaborated with cross-departmental stakeholders to ensure alignment with academic governance standards.

volunteer.position: Event Data Analyst and Communications Support
volunteer.summary: Created newsletters and reports communicating data-driven insights to a broad audience. Managed social media accounts, analyzing Instagram engagement metrics to optimize posting schedules and content strategies. Collected, validated, and reported event participation and audience interaction data. Designed dashboards and visual content to present findings and improve outreach effectiveness. Used engagement analytics to inform communication strategies and increase event visibility.

volunteer.organization: Scientific Association of Statistics and Data Science, University of Guilan
volunteer.summary: Planned and helped run data science and statistics projects for students. Organized workshops, seminars, and training sessions to teach technical skills. Worked with students, professors, and industry guests to support learning and research. Led small student teams and made sure projects were completed on time.

volunteer.position: Work shop cordinator, Introduction to R
volunteer.summary: Organized and coordinated an Introduction to R programming workshop for undergraduate students. Assisted in preparing materials, managing workshop logistics, and supporting participants during hands-on sessions. Helped students understand basic R concepts, data handling, and simple statistical analysis through guided exercises.

awards.title: Graduate Teaching Assistantship at Trent University
